noProto.description:
Description

Disallow the use of the deprecated__proto__object property.
Object.prototype.__proto__is a special accessor used to get or set the prototype of an object. \
However, it has beendeprecatedsinceECMAScript 2009, being much slower and much less reliable than its
modern counterpartsObject.getPrototypeOf()andObject.setPrototypeOf().
Since it is a regular property onObject.prototype,__proto__will not workonnull-prototype objects that do not extend fromObject.prototypenor ones having created their own__proto__properties viaObject.defineProperty.
As such, this rule encourages the use ofObject.getPrototypeOf()andObject.setPrototypeOf()in lieu of directly accessing__proto__.
Note that this doesnotcheck for the use of__proto__inside object literal definitions
to set a newly created objectâ€™s prototype,which is standard practice and well-optimized in modern browsers.
noProto.option: This rule has no specific options.
